page.title: 08Vegetation on the cliffs
page.content:
The long sweep of cliffs are densely covered in{bracken, gorse and bramble. In some localities, and particularly in the small valleys, there is quite a dense cover of{deciduous trees,}e.g. sycamore, oak and, with a advent of Dutch Elm Disease some years back, a lesser number of the once abundant elm. There are also dense patches of {sloe}locally.
The vegetation extends right down to the high tide mark around the cliffs. The first of the rocks to emerge from the vegetation cover are coated in yellow-orange{Xanthoria lichens. Below this splash zone level comes the {black lichen}zone followed downward by the usual barnacle and seaweed zones.
